item.title: Debris, discarded furniture and rubbish in front of door. Some frim a week ago., 7th July
item.description:
After making a report yesterday, some debris has been cleared though there is new builder waste, black bags and other rubbish. PLEASE START FINING PEOPLE. WHY DO WE HAVE TO LIVE WITH CONSTANT FLYTIPPING EITH NO CONSEQUENCES?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rouel Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light pollution from new garage lighting, 7th July
item.description:
Four extremely bright floodlight-style fittings have recently been installed at the rear of our property, facing directly into our windows. They are on 24/7, with no shielding or directional control, and shine straight into our bedroom and study, making it feel like daylight at night. This is causing significant disturbance and will be worse in winter. These are not standard street lights - they appear more like garage/floodlights and are inappropriately positioned for a residential area. We urgently request that the council reassess their necessity, brightness, angle, and operating hours, and install shields, dimmers, or timers as appropriate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gibbon Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More or less where indicated, 7th July
item.description:
I reported this big pothole previously under ref 7679506. I was told it was not serious enough for immediate repair and would be re-inspected 14 days later. I don't think it was re-inspected and I believe the first assessment to have been a mistake; it's a big pothole. Please could you ask the guys to have another look and double check they have the right location. Photo already supplied Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chatsworth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rye Lane, Peckham, London

item.title: Excessively bright lighting, 7th July
item.description:
Excessively bright security lighting has been installed along the garages close to the rear of our house. I understand the need for security lighting but this is causing distress and preventing adequate sleep for my household as it has excessively lit up the bedrooms and the living space. 4 months ago, we put up blackout blinds to initially mitigate the issue but more have now been installed and it is an unacceptable amount of white light to be shining into a house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selden Road, New Cross Gate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars driving through no entry, 7th July
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lower Clapton Road, Hackney, London
